intro: Stemodiopsis scutellarioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stemodia, is a perennial herb native to South America. It features slender, upright stems that are often branched and covered in fine hairs. The leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
